contents.item: A person can do incredible things if he or she has enough hope.

When by my solitary hearth I sit,When no fair dreams before my “mind’s eye” flit,And the bare heath of life presents no bloom;Sweet Hope, ethereal balm upon me shed,And wave thy silver pinions o’er my head.
Hope springs eternal in the human breast; Man never Is, but always To be blest. The soul, uneasy, and confin'd from home, Rests and expatiates in a life to come.

contents.item: Time has taught me not to lose hope, yet not to trust too much in hope either.

contents.item: There are three lessons I would write-Three words, as with a burning pen, In tracings of eternal light,Upon the heart of men.Have hope! though clouds environ round,And gladness hides her face in scorn,Put thou the shadow from thy brow,No night but hath its morn.Have love! not love alone for one, But man as man thy brother call,And scatter like the circling sun,Thy charities on all.
Only those who still have hope can benefit from tears.
contents.owner: Nathanael West, The Day of the Locust

contents.item: what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
As long as there's life, there's hope.
In an age of hope men looked up at the night sky and saw “the heavens." In an age of hopelessness they call it simply “space.
We need never be without hope because we can never be irreparably broken.
For what it's worth: it's never too late to be whoever you want to be. I hope you live a life you're proud of, and if you find you're not, I hope you have the strength to start over again.
